repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Originally reported here: https://gitlab.com/petsc/petsc/-/merge_requests/8104

I was able to get rid of almost all of these warnings, however there are two that I have not yet figured out:

```console
src/mpi4py/MPI.c:283486:19: warning: ISO C forbids conversion of function pointer to object pointer type [-Wpedantic]
283486 |   {Py_mod_create, (void*)__pyx_pymod_create},
       |                   ^
src/mpi4py/MPI.c:283487:17: warning: ISO C forbids conversion of function pointer to object pointer type [-Wpedantic]
283487 |   {Py_mod_exec, (void*)__pyx_pymod_exec_MPI},
```

comment_data.body: It sort of seems like these would be cleaner with the input argument as `void (*cfunc)(void)`. Although that probably just pushes the problem elsewhere.
I had the same thought, and arrived to the same guess about pushing the problem. However, let me take a fresh look into it.
It was the other way around, using `void (*cfunc)(void)` actually simplified things.

This gets verbose and difficult to read. Since we use macros here already, what do you think of adding a macro for making the casts and the call in one go?
```c
__Pyx_call_PyCFunctionFast(cfunc, self, args, nargs)
```

@scoder I targeted this PR to branch 3.0.x. If you think such refactors are appropriate for the release branch, then sure, we can do it. Otherwise, we should make such change in another PR targeting master once this one get merged in. Please confirm your preference.

@scoder I added a commit on top implementing the change you suggested, albeit with a slightly different naming convention `__Pyx_call_PyCFunction` ->  `__Pyx_CallCFunction`. The main rationale for this choice is that the `cfunc` argument is not really a `PyCFunction` (function) pointer, but a pointer to `struct __Pyx_CachedCFunction`.

commit.message: Silence GCC -Wpedantic in C function pointer casts

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: Silence GCC -Wpedantic in C function pointer casts
